text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e7bebc495d4014d7bc81f863939c35268cb8e97d|patch 8.2.2451: MS-Windows: Extended Attributes not preserved>
patch 8.2.2451: MS-Windows: Extended Attributes not preserved

Problem:    MS-Windows: Extended Attributes not preserved.
Solution:   Preserve Extended Attributes when writing a file. (Ken Takata,
            closes #7765)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2451: MS-Windows: Extended Attributes not preserved · vim/vim@e7bebc4
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2451: MS-Windows: Extended Attributes not preserved · vim/vim@e7bebc4
attachments.text: Problem: MS-Windows: Extended Attributes not preserved. Solution: Preserve Extended Attributes when writing a file. (Ken Takata, closes #7765)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/7781ebe50f6d4daba02be3bd7e6ca08cd459674b|patch 8.2.2450: MS-Windows: ADS was not preserved if 'backupcopy' is …>
patch 8.2.2450: MS-Windows: ADS was not preserved if 'backupcopy' is "yes"

Problem:    MS-Windows: ADS was not preserved if 'backupcopy' is "yes".
Solution:   Copy ADS before truncating the file. (Ken Takata, closes #7762)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2450: MS-Windows: ADS was not preserved if 'backupcopy' is … · vim/vim@7781ebe
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2450: MS-Windows: ADS was not preserved if 'backupcopy' is … · vim/vim@7781ebe
attachments.text: …"yes" Problem: MS-Windows: ADS was not preserved if 'backupcopy' is "yes". Solution: Copy ADS before truncating the file. (Ken Takata, closes #7762)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/3b690069730805a147d45d92eaca4dc838272d1d|patch 8.2.2449: Vim9: flatten() always changes the list type>
patch 8.2.2449: Vim9: flatten() always changes the list type

Problem:    Vim9: flatten() always changes the list type.
Solution:   Disallow using flatten() and add flattennew().

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2449: Vim9: flatten() always changes the list type · vim/vim@3b69006
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2449: Vim9: flatten() always changes the list type · vim/vim@3b69006
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: flatten() always changes the list type. Solution: Disallow using flatten() and add flattennew().

patch 8.2.2448: compilation error with Ruby 3.0

Problem:    Compilation error with Ruby 3.0.
Solution:   Adjust #ifdefs and declaration. (Ken Takata, closes #7761)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f9547eb6ef02e305203b859d2dcfdae930b9d544|patch 8.2.2447: 'foldlevel' not applied to folds restored from session>
patch 8.2.2447: 'foldlevel' not applied to folds restored from session

Problem:    'foldlevel' not applied to folds restored from session.
Solution:   Set 'foldlevel' after creaiting the folds. (closes #7767)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2447: 'foldlevel' not applied to folds restored from session · vim/vim@f9547eb
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2447: 'foldlevel' not applied to folds restored from session · vim/vim@f9547eb
attachments.text: Problem: 'foldlevel' not applied to folds restored from session. Solution: Set 'foldlevel' after creaiting the folds. (closes #7767)

patch 8.2.2446: setting 'term' empty has different error if compiled with GUI

Problem:    Setting 'term' empty has different error if compiled with GUI.
Solution:   Insert "else". (closes #7766)
